history.content: This is exactly the process I went through. I got in contact with my math advisor and after relaying the signed double major form from the CS department, he was able to sign it very quickly, allowing me to send it to L&S within a few days. I would highly recommend that you keep all the forms filled out and just send the documents to the correct entity as the time comes.

children.subject: Got it. So specifically speaking did you apply to CS and math the same time, waiting for CS's signature and send the double major form separately later to the math department or did you first apply CS, got the signature at the end of the semester and applied to Math with everything ready the next semester?

history.content: I'm intended to declare cs and Applied Math. Since I took CS70 to replace math55, math department said they will not process my declaration until CS declares me. So I will have to declare cs first, meaning uploading the double major form without the other apatment's signature to CS, which is not suggested by the departement(I think it wants us to upload the double major form with the other department's signature). In this case, I'm wondering will I get declared into CS even if the double major form is lacking math's signature? In other words, will the process be: CS declares me, CS signs double major form, send application and double major form to math department, math declares me, math signs double major form, I send the double major form to L&S?
history.subject: Apply double major in CS and Applied Math
